parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To help, benefit, do good, be useful (to), profit. From the same as opheleia; to be useful, i.e. To benefit.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To gain, acquire, win (over), avoid loss. From kerdos; to gain.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From zemia; to injure, i.e. to experience detriment.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
